Header: DISCUSSION BETWEEN RAILWAY TRADE UNIONS TODAY
Content: The strike launched by several trade unions including railway drivers and regulators regarding salary anomalies continues today for the 7 th day. The Railway Control Room stated that seven trains were added to the train schedule this morning. Meanwhile, the Co-convener of the Railway Monitoring Operations Officers' Association Lal Ariyaratne stated that their trade unions will meet today at 10.00 am to discuss measures to include all the railway trade unions for the continuous strike. At a Cabinet meeting held yesterday, a proposal to make the railway service a closed service in order to solve railway employees' problems was approved.
